contexts.context: Kneppe’s words dug into Meir’s <mark>heart</mark> like arrows. But he kept calm and said...
...blood and will take out all of my evil <mark>heart</mark> on you. Now go wherever you want to....
...They therefore should be planted deep in the young <mark>hearts</mark>, love, and respect for their people,...
...the Jewish spirit and feel it in the young <mark>hearts</mark>, and to awaken and maintain the love for...
It is sad to recount, our <mark>hearts</mark> hurt and we want to cry when we look...
